meanings.definition: The quality of having superior power, influence, or force.
meanings.sent1: His prepotency in the company made him the go-to person for important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The king's prepotency over his subjects was unquestionable.
meanings.sent3: The prepotency of the boss in the office was so strong that even the coffee machine obeyed his commands.
meanings.sent4: Her prepotency in negotiations was akin to a lioness leading her pride.
meanings.sent5: The prepotency of the storm was evident in the way it uprooted trees and scattered debris everywhere.

meanings.definition: The ability to produce offspring with consistent and desired traits.
meanings.sent1: The mare's prepotency in passing on speed to her foals made her a valuable asset to the racing stable.
meanings.sent2: Geneticists study the prepotency of certain traits in breeding programs.
meanings.sent3: The prepotency of the farmer's prized bull led to a new generation of strong and healthy calves.
meanings.sent4: The prepotency of the seed's genetics ensured a bountiful harvest for the farmer.
meanings.sent5: The prepotency of the trait for disease resistance saved the entire crop from destruction.

meanings.definition: Dominance or predominance in a particular situation or context.
meanings.sent1: The prepotency of her argument swayed the jury in her favor.
meanings.sent2: In the world of sports, prepotency can often determine the outcome of a match.
meanings.sent3: The prepotency of the team captain's leadership style inspired his teammates to give their best.
meanings.sent4: The prepotency of the sun in the sky overshadowed all other celestial bodies.
meanings.sent5: The prepotency of the waterfall's roar drowned out all other sounds in the forest.
